title: Which is the correct sentence, “what an idea” or “which idea”? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are you trying to say? These sentences are both correct in different circumstances. You would say “What an idea.” if you wanted someone to know you thought an idea was very good or very crazy. A: “Let’s go to the ice cream store and taste every flavour.” B: “What and idea. Let’s do it.” or A: “I think it should be illegal to own pets.” B: “What an idea! Why would you want that to be a law? You’re crazy. The sentence “Which idea?” is just asking for someone to pick an idea or to be reminded about an idea. A: “We have a lot of good ideas for the next story. Which idea do you like best?” or A: “I think his last idea was the best one.” B: “Which idea was that? Remind me.”

First a few corrections. ‘What an idea’ is an exclamatory sentence, so it should be written as: What an idea! The second one ‘which idea’ is not a sentence, but you can frame a question sentence like: Which idea did appeal to you most? I hope this helps.
